intro: Silene conica subsp. subconica, commonly known as the narrow-coned catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind.
